intro: Amoora aherniana, commonly known as the New Zealand nightshade, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple. Its berries are toxic and contain alkaloids, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals. Amoora aherniana is often found in coastal and forested areas, thriving in moist, shaded environments.
